JOB DESCRIPTION:
['Help us boldly shape retail in Canada', '
', 'Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.', '
', 'The Data Analyst supports the Marketing Promo team by ensuring that the data feeds into the development and operating tools and models that are used to improve flyer/offer performance are accurate, free of errors and well understood. They will perform this function through data monitoring, sampling, cross referencing, auditing and other procedures that are to be defined by the Promotions Research & Analytics team. They also participate in the creation of new data to be used in the development and execution of tools that are being or have been developed, as well as project work that will involve the sourcing of new data to ensure it is captured to the appropriate specifications.', '
', '
', 'What you’ll do
', 'Work with multiple and complex data sources and performs operational data management through, data auditing and monitoring, data validation, and data cleansing/corrections
', 'New data creation, maintenance and validation including making assessments on missing data elements.
 ', 'Acts as central point of contact with BU SMEs to validate new data, the source, and other inputs as required
', 'Use visual modelling tools to simplify and automate data creation and maintenance
', 'Documentation of data sources and standards
', 'Identify data improvement opportunities and simplify data management techniques and processes
', 'Provide ad hoc analysis as required
', 'Who you are', '
', 'We are looking for individuals who are:
', 'Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
', 'Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
', 'Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
', 'Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
', 'If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.', '
', 'What you bring
', 'Related College diploma or University degree
', 'Knowledge or experience in data management practices and techniques
', 'Knowledge or experience in common data issues and cleansing/repair techniques
', 'Knowledge, familiarity with standard desktop tools (MS Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
', 'Knowledge of databases: Access, Hive, Netezza, data warehouse and data lake structures
', 'Understanding of Big Data paradigms / performance tuning
', 'Familiarity with visual ETL/modelling tools an asset (KNIME, SAS Enterprise Miner, SPSS Modeller)
', 'Good written and verbal communication skills, experience writing documentation an asset.
', 'Exceptional attention to detail
', 'In addition to submitting your application for this role, please visit this ', 'link ', 'to complete an initial screening questionnaire', '
', 'About Canadian Tire Corporation', '
', '
', 'Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies .', '
', 'To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn .
', '#LI-SS1
 ', 'Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. CTR Marketing
', 'Ontario-Toronto
', 'Permanent
', 'Full-time
', 'Job Posting
 ', ': Mar 12, 2020, 10:29:06 AM']

JOB DESCRIPTION:
['Why join us?
', 'As a key member of the Global Investments IT team, the role of the Data Analyst is instrumental in enhancing data & analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering high quality datasets, reports, and training to enhance business decision making.
', 'You will develop Power BI datasets and reports to support OMERS investment entities, deliver training workshops to promote data culture, and maintain a healthy business relationship to assist in meeting business demands. You will also support and collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and knowledge sharing through the implementation lifecycle of projects and solutions.
', 'This role is accountable for ensuring that all projects, solutions and platforms align with and support overall enterprise Data & Technology strategy & goals, and adhere to company policies, industry standards and best practices.
', '
', 'As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:', '
', '
', 'Leading workshops with stakeholders to gather requirements and develop low/high fidelity wireframes', '
', 'Developing and monitoring Power BI Premium Dataflows to gather, transform and democratize structured and unstructured data assets', '
', 'Developing Power BI datasets by applying best-practice semantic modeling techniques', '
', 'Creating visually stunning reports that clearly communicate an effective story', '
', 'Operating in an Agile development environment', '
', 'Communicating effectively with other analysts in the same team, with other teams and with various other stakeholders such as product managers, data engineers and members of senior management', '
', 'Participating in solution build, delivery, support and troubleshooting', '
', 'Managing change and communicate impacts to stakeholders and fellow team members', '
', 'Exhibiting ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and ensure on-time delivery', '
', 'Identifying, defining and implementing opportunities for enhancing existing processes', '
', '
', 'To succeed in this role, you have:', '
', '
', 'Experience. 3+ years solving complex technical projects as a full-stack (M & DAX) Power BI developer is required', '
', 'Industry Knowledge. Ability to quickly propose solutions by recalling the latest best practices learned from MVP & Product Team articles, MSFT documentation, whitepapers, and other community publications is required', '
', 'Training. Excited to support new Power BI users by running various internal community initiatives such as presentations, hands-on workshops, or troubleshooting end-user obstacles.', '
', 'Relationship Building. Proven track record of building deep technical relationships. Experience in aligning expectations across various stakeholders.', '
', 'Problem-Solving. Able to trace data lineage and resolve technical issues with minimal supervision.', '
', 'Teamwork. Motivated and keen to work in a collaborative environment with a focus on team success over and above individual success.', '
', 'Depth of Power BI experience wrangling complex data using M functions and developing sophisticated semantic logic using DAX expressions is required', '
', 'Breadth of technical experience and knowledge in the MSFT data and analytics ecosystem, with Subject Matter Expertise in two or more of the following items is required:', '
', '
o Power BI Service administration
', 'o Tabular Editor
', 'o Information Design theory
', 'o SSAS Tabular
', 'o PowerApps
', 'o Flow or Logic Apps
', 'o SQL Server
', 'o Azure Data Factory v2 or SSIS
', 'o AzureML
', 'o Azure Databricks
', '
', '
', 'Bachelor’s Degree in an appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience is required', '
', 'Microsoft certifications', '
', '
', 'Our story:', '
ABOUT OMERS Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $97 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2018. A jointly sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers, OMERS invests and administers pensions on behalf of almost half a million active and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS has employees in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. For more information on OMERS, visit www.omers.com .OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Exchange Bank of Canada is currently seeking an enthusiastic professional for our Data Analyst position at our office in Toronto. The main function of the Data Analyst is to assist the Data Analytics Team.', 'Exchange Bank of Canada (EBC) is a Schedule 1 bank based in Toronto, Canada. EBC is wholly-owned by Currency Exchange International Corp., a publicly traded company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (CXI) and OTC (CURN). As a specialist in wholesale foreign exchange services, EBC provides a wide range of foreign currency exchange and international payment services to financial institutions and corporations tailored to streamline processes and delivered with unparalleled customer service.', 'Essential Functions: ', 'Utilize advanced analytical technics to solve business problems.', 'Develop a strong experience in analytics, data mining, reporting, visualization and automation.', 'Run queries for descriptive analytics to provide result and recommendations.', 'Contribute to the creation of reports relating to transactional data.', 'Bridge the gap between technical needs and the business needs.', 'Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights.', 'Aid in the preparation of weekly finance metrics and reports.', 'Assist with other projects on an as-needed basis, including: Data integrity auditing, database reconciliation and client classification.', 'Capabilities: ', 'Adaptability: ', 'Self-starter with desire to grow in the role and passion to deliver results.', 'Relentless desire to improve processes that add value to the organization', 'Must take initiative, work independently, use sound judgment and make well-informed decisions', 'Adjust quickly to different work situations; remain composed under pressure and stressful situations.', 'Principled, self-motivated, and driven to work towards Group objectives', 'Develop an understanding of foreign exchange markets', 'Attention to Detail: ', 'Regard for all important details to assure accuracy and validity of models, reports and decisions; ability to detect errors; follow-through on corrections and details.', 'Oral/Written Communication: ', 'Must be able to communicate thoughts clearly, both orally and written. Must be able to communicate throughout the organization including to senior management as well as to external contacts.', 'Technology: ', 'Proven skills in business intelligence, query, and scripting tools, including but not limited to VBA, SQL, SAS, Python, Matlab, R', 'Experience with business intelligence tools and visualization concepts, including but not limited to Tableau, MS Power BI.', 'Ability to organize and manage large volumes of data to synthesize into predictive models which drive decision making.', 'Must be highly competent with significant expertise in multiple computer software packages, primarily focused in the Microsoft Office Suite of programs including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, but not exclusively.', 'Time Management: ', 'Ability to effectively manage time and prioritize projects to complete work according to established deadlines.', 'Required Education and Experience: ', 'Possess a degree in Accounting, Economics, Business, Finance, Statistics or Mathematics', '1 to 3 years of experience in a data analytics environment', 'Knowledge of data management, auditing, and statistical analysis preferred.', 'Experience with data manipulation and data quality assurance.', 'Experience with querying databases; familiarity with relational database concepts', 'Ability to generate impactful and interactive data visualizations using existing technologies to provide actionable insights', 'Please attach your resume for submission.', 'Job Type: Full-time']

JOB DESCRIPTION:
['As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent for our Bingo team in Toronto. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.', '
', '
', 'PERKS & BENEFITS', '
Unlimited Vacation, Paid Sick Days & Holidays*', '
100% Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plan*', '
Life Insurance, RRSP matching, Flexible Spending Accounts & More*', '
Catered Lunches & Well-stocked Kitchens', '
Company Events such as movie night, pub night and more…', "
You'll be equipped with a high-end laptop, monitor and mobile device", '
Convenient location in downtown Toronto’s entertainment and technology district', 'Only applies to full-time positions.', '
', '
ABOUT THE ROLE', '
We are currently looking for a ', 'Data Analyst', ' to join our Bingo Pop team! You will get the opportunity to work with some of gaming’s top talent, while lending your analytical talents to help us create top-tier mobile games. Our ideal candidate would have a strong appetite to learn, inquire and apply their knowledge to give informed proposals on the design of our game.', '
', 'RESPONSIBILITIES', '
Building reports, dashboards and data visualizations that are used everyday by team leads and executives.', '
Developing new metrics and player cohorts to unlock insights into player behavior.', '
Assisting in the design of new game features.', '
Helping to manage billions of rows of data along with our data pipeline.', '
Responding to ad-hoc requests from the executive, financial or marketing teams when insights into our data are needed.', '
', 'QUALIFICATIONS', '
BA/BS degree or equivalent.', '
1+ years of experience working with data on a live product.', '
Strong data analysis skills using spreadsheets and querying databases.', '
Previous startup experience is desirable, comfort in an agile environment.', '
Strong understanding of SQL or Redshift and proficiency in data visualization.', '
Strong attention to detail and proven analytical skills.', '
The ability to communicate and present information clearly.', '
An appetite to learn, grow, and take on increasingly more responsibility.', '
A strong desire to answer questions that can drive actionable decisions.', '
Knowledge of the mobile gaming industry in order to provide recommendations on game design.', '
', 'NICE TO HAVE', '
Experience working on a free to play mobile game.', '
', 'ABOUT JAM CITY', '
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.', '
', '
', 'Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.', '
', '
', 'The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.', '
', '
', 'Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.']

JOB DESCRIPTION:
['Zensurance is looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst to help us make better sense of our data. You’ll be working with the Sales and Product teams to help us pinpoint and address inefficiencies in our business. You’ll also work with Engineering to ensure the integrity of our data, and to help automate the repetitive parts of your job so that you can spend your time doing what’s important: solving business problems!', '
', 'Responsibilities', '
Architect efficient and scalable solutions to answer questions about our business.', '
Distill large datasets from our data warehouse into useable dashboard for stakeholders.', '
Write clean and efficient SQL to transform raw data into models.', '
Help with the implementation and adoption of business intelligence solutions.', '
', 'Nice to have', '
Experience using dbt to layer views/models', '
Experience with git', '
Comfortable on the command line', '
Some programming experience', '
Experience working in an Agile environment', '
Experience surfacing business insights, including defining and measure KPIs', '
', 'Required Qualifications', '
4+ years in a similar role', '
Advanced SQL knowledge', '
Experience with data warehouses and large data sets', '
Proficient in Excel', '
Strong written and verbal communication skills', '
Experience creating data visualizations', '
Comfortable with ambiguity', '
Degree in Commerce, Business, or Computer Science, or equivalent experience', '
', 'Perks we offer at Zensurance:', '
', ' Opportunity to work for Canada’s fastest growing insurtech start up', ' Contemporary office downtown TO, 1 minute from Osgoode Station and 7 minutes from Union Station', ' Flexible work environment / work from home arrangements available to everyone', ' Modern technology - laptops provided to all staff', ' Comprehensive, flexible health and dental plans to suit all lifestyles', ' Weekly Friday company-wide meetings in our comfortable #zenden with beverages and great snacks', ' Build next level relationships with your peers through scheduled companywide team building events', ' Be a part of something special, we are confident you won’t find any other insurance company like us :)', '
', "
Who we are. What we're building.", '
', '
Business is hard work, insurance doesn’t have to be!', '
', '
', 'At Zensurance we believe that ', 'teamwork', ' makes the ', 'dream work', '.', '
', '
We are passionate about providing business owners with the best insurance solutions at great rates through an online and easy to use platform.', '
', '
Our secret sauce is all about our culture. Here at Zensurance our culture is built on three core values that we live and breathe everyday, they are:', '
', '
INSPIRE:', ' We put people first and empower them to be the best they can be.', '
', '
INVENT:', ' We take an innovative approach to creating straightforward solutions for our customers.', '
', '
DELIVER:', ' We set ambitious goals and hold ourselves accountable to achieving them.', '
', '

', '

CLUSTER JOB:
Zensurance is looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst to help us make better sense of our data. You’ll be working with the Sales and Product teams to help us pinpoint and address inefficiencies in our business. You’ll also work with Engineering to ensure the integrity of our data, and to help automate the repetitive parts of your job so that you can spend your time doing what’s important: solving business problems!', '
', 'Responsibilities', '
Architect efficient and scalable solutions to answer questions about our business.', '
Distill large datasets from our data warehouse into useable dashboard for stakeholders.', '
Write clean and efficient SQL to transform raw data into models.', '
Help with the implementation and adoption of business intelligence solutions.', '
', 'Nice to have', '
Experience using dbt to layer views/models', '
Experience with git', '
Comfortable on the command line', '
Some programming experience', '
Experience working in an Agile environment', '
Experience surfacing business insights, including defining and measure KPIs', '
', 'Required Qualifications', '
4+ years in a similar role', '
Advanced SQL knowledge', '
Experience with data warehouses and large data sets', '
Proficient in Excel', '
Strong written and verbal communication skills', '
Experience creating data visualizations', '
Comfortable with ambiguity', '
Degree in Commerce, Business, or Computer Science, or equivalent experience', '
', 'Perks we offer at Zensurance:', '

JOB DESCRIPTION:
['Access Full Position Posting', '
', '
', 'Purpose:', "
Launched in October 2014, York University's new School of Continuing Studies (the 'School') is rapidly expanding. It will be one of the largest and most innovative of its kind in the country with the potential to reflect the full spectrum of the continuing education field. With unique course delivery models and top quality programs, the School will increase the University's adult and international student population and will be central to the University's overall growth strategy. Reporting to the Executive Officer, the incumbent is responsible for updating, analyzing and reporting on day-to-day performance of various data elements, such as student enrolment and registration data, web analytics, course evaluation data, phone & Live Chat services, and other types of data as made available. The Data Analyst prepares detailed analytics, trend analyses, reports and dashboards for the School's management team. The incumbent will also research, recommend, test, implement and provide user training for software solutions specific to the data collection, analysis and reporting. In addition, the incumbent will be responsible for the integrity and accuracy of data related to the School, its programs and its students. As a member of the IT team, the Data Analyst's responsibilities also include supporting general IT- related requests as needed. The incumbent will manage a wide range of IT data services and will be responsible for utilizing a customer service orientated approach in order to deliver timely, reliable and accurate results.", '
', '
', 'Education:', '
Undergraduate degree. Preferably in computer science, math/statistics, or business. Or equivalent combination of liberal arts degree with further education/experience computer science or data analytics, or an equivalent of 4 years recent experience (defined as within the last five years) working at York University and performing the same or similar tasks. This education equivalency is in addition to the experiential requirements outlined below.', '
', '
', 'Experience:', '
Minimum two (2) years of work experience in data analysis and related application tools in a business office/results oriented service environment. An understanding of and appreciation for continuing education in an academic environment is desirable. Knowledge of a Student Registration and Information System, and the data contained, is an asset. Experience in managing IT data projects and coordinating effective work flow in a fast-paced office is preferred.', '
', '
', 'Skills:', '
Demonstrable advanced proficiency and experience with desktop productivity tools like Excel, Google Analytics, and other data reporting applications is required. Advanced knowledge of, and direct working experience with, a relational database management system (such as Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server). Understanding and experience using report-generating software such as SQL Server Reporting Services, Actuate BIRT Report designer or Crystal Reports. Demonstrated competencies of data management. - Exposure to or experience with Tableau. Excellent oral and written communication skills with strong analytical skills. Confidence to make informed decisions and to make recommendations based on those decisions- Ability to question in detail to understand and gather end user requirements and translate into solutions. Exceptional interpersonal skills, detail oriented. Sets high standards of performance for self and desires constant improvement over previous levels. Proactive in responding to client needs and requirements. Plans ahead in order to establish an efficient and appropriate course of action for self. Critically evaluates a problem or issue identifying a range of possible options for solutions. Experience working as an effective member of a team.', '
', '
', 'Additional Notes:', '
This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.', '
', '
Access Full Position Posting', '
', 'In order to be considered as an internal applicant, York University employees in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit ', 'must', ' apply for jobs through the ', 'Employee Career Portal - YU Hire.', '
', '
', 'If you are a current York University employee in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit and/or are using your job posting rights under the collective agreement to apply for jobs, you MUST log into ', 'YU Hire', ' to access the York University Employee Career Portal.', '
', '
', 'As per Article 12.02(f) of the YUSA-1 Collective Agreement, to be considered an internal applicant, employees in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit ', 'must submit the application 5 working days following the first day of posting', '. this is referred to as the ', "'Posted Date'", ' on the job the posting. This applies to YUSA-1 internal and YUSA-1 Concurrent postings. Please refer to the ', "'Posting Intent'", ' on the job posting.', '
', '
', 'If not filled by an employee in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit, employees in the YUSA-2 bargaining unit who have applied within the first 5 days from the ', "'Posted Date'", ' will be given preference.', '
', '
', 'The University welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including, but not limited to women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities (racialized), aboriginal (Indigenous) persons and persons of any gender identity and sexual orientation. York University is committed to a positive, supportive and inclusive environment.', '
', '
', '
', 'York University offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you are contacted by York University regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.', '
', '
', '
', 'We are committed to enhancing our environmentally and socially responsible practices for the benefit of all members of the York community. Our long term perspective recognizes our responsibility to be innovators and to continually work as a community to reduce our ecological impact.', '
', '
', '
', 'York University employees must apply to jobs through the Employee Career Portal - YU Hire. If you are a current York University employee and/or are using your rights under a collective agreement to view and/or apply to jobs, you MUST log into YU Hire to access the York University Employee Career Portal.', '
', '
', '
', 'PLEASE NOTE: All applications must be received by 11:55 pm EST on the posted deadline date, if applicable.']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Reporting to: ', ' Senior Solutions Architect', 'Responsibilities & Duties: ', '- Data validation/scrubbing between in-house central SQL server database and other third-party sources', '- Manage/Create daily batch job schedule, debug and rerun failed jobs', '- Take ownership of issues by carrying out problem analysis to implement temporary or permanent fixes with the aim of restoring service to an employee as soon as possible; escalating incidents to other support teams where necessary', '- Keep procedure manuals up to date', 'Qualifications & Skills', '- Solid knowledge of database design and writing SQL Server queries, view & stored procedure, is a MUST', '- Trouble shooting and failure resolution skills is a MUST', '- Extensive understanding of RDBMS', '- Experience with Bloomberg terminal is a plus', '- Proficient with Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel', '- Familiarity with portfolio accounting practices, reporting, and trading', '- Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels in the organization', '- Excellent interpersonal skills with a customer service orientation', '- Ability to work in a busy environment with frequent interruptions while prioritizing and resolving user requests', '- Exceptional attention to detail', '- Self-starter, able to work under minimal supervision', '- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills', '- Team player with a positive attitude', '- Availability for occasional off-hours or weekend tasks', 'Benefits:', 'Extended health care', 'Vacation & paid time off', 'Dental care', 'Job Type: Full-time']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Title: ', 'Data Analyst', 'Location: ', 'Toronto Head Office', 'Department: ', ' Logistics', 'Reporting to: ', ' Supply and Rail Manager', 'Company Profile', 'McAsphalt Industries Limited, formed in 1970, is a diversified Canadian company committed to the development, production, distribution and marketing of asphaltic products, related services and technology. Recognized as the industry leader, McAsphalt offers the widest range of asphalt products from our 26 strategically located terminals, coast to coast, across Canada. The company’s success is based on our employees’ dedication to providing total customer satisfaction by supplying superior quality asphalt products combined with strong, experienced technical support.', 'Role: ', 'This is a full-time role primarily responsible for building models for supply data analysis, and providing recommendations that will support our supply and rail freight functions. The Data Analyst will support the manager in procuring information from Operations, Sales, Finance/IT and Purchasing. The core functions of the role will be to develop metrics for forecasting, developing loading schedules, and tracking market and category trends. The position will work with the supply and logistics team on delivery reporting and analysis and creating usable reports from information collected from applicable sources and McAsphalt’s corporate ERP system.', 'The role will also include KPI Monitoring and analysis pertaining to sales data, forecasting accuracy, inventory, freight tables and demurrage. Analyzing current process and new forecasting methodologies, tools, and techniques to help improve forecast accuracy and create overall Supply Chain efficiencies.', 'General Duties and responsibilities: ', 'Collection of data for development of product level forecasts', 'Tracking rail costs and demurrage nationally, for the purpose of attaining maximum efficiency', 'Development of Metrics for Inventory and all replenishment flows', 'Ensure all data management pertaining to forecasts, product and vendor attributes are maintained', 'Undertake process improvement efforts focused on improving KPI’s', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Must be detail oriented', 'Must have strong computer skills, especially with Excel', 'Previous experience with SAP and SQL reporting is an asset.', 'Familiarity with Navision', 'Post-secondary education in Business, Economics, Engineering or Marketing', '2-3 years experience in the oil and gas or manufacturing business would be an asset', 'Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment', 'Interested applicants are requested to apply to Human Resources by February 22, 2019. Send your resume and cover letter to:', 'Human Resources', '8800 Sheppard Ave East', 'Toronto, Ontario', 'M1B 5R4', 'www.mcasphalt.com', 'We thank all applicants; only successful candidates will be contacted', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent']

The company’s success is based on our employees’ dedication to providing total customer satisfaction by supplying superior quality asphalt products combined with strong, experienced technical support.', 'Role: ', 'This is a full-time role primarily responsible for building models for supply data analysis, and providing recommendations that will support our supply and rail freight functions. The Data Analyst will support the manager in procuring information from Operations, Sales, Finance/IT and Purchasing. JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange, Russel Metals is one of the largest metals distribution and processing companies in North America servicing customers primarily in Canada and the United States. The company conducts business in three metals distribution segments: metals service centers, energy products and steel distributors.', 'We are looking for a Data Analyst, one that has proven success in medium to large, multi-branch organisations in a supply chain or manufacturing environment. Reporting to the Director of ERP Implementation and as part of the IS group, this role will work closely with our ERP implementation partner consultants, various business stakeholders, and members of our technology team to successfully implement a BI solution to support our ERP implementation and rollout in a multi-phase, multi-site project spanning Canada and the US for the Metals Service Centers segment.', 'Main Responsibilities:', 'Work collaboratively with our implementation partner and internal team members to design and architect solutions ensuring best industry and application practices.', 'Understand the data architecture in core applications to develop pertinent data sets and models for reporting, leveraging business subject matter experts as needed.', 'Understand business operations to create relevant reports and analytics on the Birst platform.', 'Architect core business dashboards, widgets, reports and virtualizations.', 'Assist in formulation of overall analytics governance model.', 'Build custom views and ad-hoc reports based on functional designs.', 'Build templates and data sets for end user consumption.', 'Construct and manage the Data Lake.', 'Work with in house developers to mine and migrate legacy data.', 'Act as the organisational lead within the Birst application.', 'Assist in education and construction of training materials.', 'Ensure tasks are completed in line with overall project plan, timeline and budget.', 'Proactively identify potential risks and gaps to ensure proper mitigating strategies can be developed and communicated transparently.', 'Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Required:', 'Strong understanding of business systems and processes.', '3-5 years of experience using Birst or similar top tier BI Platform (Power BI, Tableau etc.)', 'Strong SQL skills', 'Ability to identify opportunities for optimisation through the project cycle and post go-live.', 'Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in English (French an asset.).', 'Effective interpersonal skills and a strong customer service focus including demonstrated flexibility and end user advocacy.', 'Highly self-motivated and proactive.', 'Well organised with excellent analytical, interpersonal and facilitation skills with a strong customer service focus including demonstrated flexibility and end user advocacy .', 'Travel to locations in the US and Canada may be required (20-30%).', 'QUALIFIED APPLICANTS MUST HOLD APPROPRIATE CITIZENSHIP OR DOCUMENTS PERMITTING THEM TO RESIDE IN AND WORK IN CANADA AND TRAVEL TO THE US.', 'Interested candidates are encouraged to apply at: Recruitment @ russelmetals. com', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent', 'Experience:', 'using Birst or a top tier BI program: 3 years (Required)']

The company conducts business in three metals distribution segments: metals service centers, energy products and steel distributors.', 'We are looking for a Data Analyst, one that has proven success in medium to large, multi-branch organisations in a supply chain or manufacturing environment. Reporting to the Director of ERP Implementation and as part of the IS group, this role will work closely with our ERP implementation partner consultants, various business stakeholders, and members of our technology team to successfully implement a BI solution to support our ERP implementation and rollout in a multi-phase, multi-site project spanning Canada and the US for the Metals Service Centers segment.', 'Main Responsibilities:', 'Work collaboratively with our implementation partner and internal team members to design and architect solutions ensuring best industry and application practices.', 'Understand the data architecture in core applications to develop pertinent data sets and models for reporting, leveraging business subject matter experts as needed.', 'Understand business operations to create relevant reports and analytics on the Birst platform.', 'Architect core business dashboards, widgets, reports and virtualizations.', 'Assist in formulation of overall analytics governance model.', 'Build custom views and ad-hoc reports based on functional designs.', 'Build templates and data sets for end user consumption.', 'Construct and manage the Data Lake.', 'Work with in house developers to mine and migrate legacy data.', 'Act as the organisational lead within the Birst application.', 'Assist in education and construction of training materials.', 'Ensure tasks are completed in line with overall project plan, timeline and budget.', 'Proactively identify potential risks and gaps to ensure proper mitigating strategies can be developed and communicated transparently.', 'Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Required:', 'Strong understanding of business systems and processes.', '3-5 years of experience using Birst or similar top tier BI Platform (Power BI, Tableau etc.)', 'Strong SQL skills', 'Ability to identify opportunities for optimisation through the project cycle and post go-live.', 'Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in English (French an asset.).', 'Effective interpersonal skills and a strong customer service focus including demonstrated flexibility and end user advocacy.', 'Highly self-motivated and proactive.', 'Well organised with excellent analytical, interpersonal and facilitation skills with a strong customer service focus including demonstrated flexibility and end user advocacy .', 'Travel to locations in the US and Canada may be required (20-30%).', 'QUALIFIED APPLICANTS MUST HOLD APPROPRIATE CITIZENSHIP OR DOCUMENTS PERMITTING THEM TO RESIDE IN AND WORK IN CANADA AND TRAVEL TO THE US.', 'Interested candidates are encouraged to apply at: Recruitment @ russelmetals. com', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent', 'Experience:', 'using Birst or a top tier BI program: 3 years (Required)

JOB DESCRIPTION:
['TECHNATION', '
', '
Connecting Technology, Government and Community for Canada’s Future. A clear reflection of our role and mandate to our members and our nation.', '
', '
', '
TECHNATION (formerly Information Technology Association of Canada (ITAC)) is seeking a full-time Data Analyst within the Future Workforce Development team.', '
', '
', '
About Us', '
', '
', '
TECHNATION is Canada’s national business association representing a diverse membership that is at the forefront of Canada’s digital economy. Our members include some of the largest global tech companies, but also a high number of innovate small and medium sized companies. Talent is the foundation of both Canada’s rapidly expanding ICT sector and of ICT-based innovations and capabilities in every sector of our economy.', '
', '
', '
Position Location', '
', '
', '
5090 Explorer Drive, Suite 510, Mississauga, Ontario, Canada, L4W 4T9', '
', '
', '
About the Role', '
', '
', '
Reports to A/VP, Future Workforce Development', '
', '
', '
This is a fixed term contract:', '
', '
', 'Start date: May 1st, 2020', '
', '
', 'End date: March 1st, 2022', '
', '
', 'Full time, 40 hours per week', '
', '
', 'Work may require effort beyond normal working hours and occasionally on weekends.', '
', '
', 'Work may require occasional travel within Canada and the U.S. to attend conferences or support Future Workforce Development initiatives.', '
', '
', '
The successful candidate will:', '
', '
', 'Manage and support TECHNATION workforce development data analysis needs to include:', '
', '
', '
o Plan, analyze, and report on key data points on the Canadian workforce from multiple sources', '
', '
', '
o Monitor Canadian labour market information for ICT trends,', '
', '
', '
o Conduct online research of Canadian technical educational & training programs/program components', '
', '
', '
o Liaise with national data generators and tap into data sources to support TECHNATION requirements', '
', '
', '
o Support execution of interviews, focus groups and surveys in support of TECHNATION Future Workforce Development requirements', '
', '
', '
o Develop and support data lifecycle management', '
', '
', '
o Draft reports and recommendations', '
', '
', 'Support definition, development and maintenance of data sets used in TECHNATION platform/workforce development applications', '
', '
', '
o Advise on data collection, analysis and reporting in terms of the application of artificial intelligence and data science in the Future Workforce Development Programs and online tools (realizing that this is an emergent field, basic knowledge is required with the expectation that the Analyst’s learning and experience in the role will enhance their ability to advise in this area).', '
', '
', '
o Lead data structure and data definition discussions within TN to support improved data capture, use and management', '
', '
', '
o Investigate and support development of technical statement of requirements related to data and data management', '
', '
', '
o Participate in testing of tools once delivered by vendor prior to roll out, including assisting in the development and completion of a requirements acceptance matrix based on technical and non-technical requirements', '
', '
', '
o Provide database management support', '
', '
', '
o As a ‘content manager’, identify and modify content within TECHNATION workforce development applications', '
', '
', 'Other tasks as required to support the project including:', '
', '
', '
o Supporting TECHNATION events and meetings as required', '
', '
', '
o Assist with acquisition and the coordination of translation', '
', '
', '
o Tracking and reporting on key performance indicators', '
', '
', '
o Minor project management and working with TECHNATION leaders to scope project requirements and monitor project deliverables', '
', '
', '
o Developing briefs and conducting presentations', '
', '
', '
o Research to maximize participant experience, improve efficiency and solidify the TECHNATION brand', '
', '
', '
o Other duties as assigned', '
', '
', '
Mandatory Qualifications:', '
', '
', 'Diploma or degree in IT, data analysis, database management, econometrics or related field where data analysis is a key function.', '
', '
', '3+ years of experience working in an electronic data-driven environment to include data analysis and reporting and data lifecycle management', '
', '
', 'Experience in employment or job-based research, analysis and reporting', '
', '
', 'Education and experience in quantitative and qualitative research', '
', '
', 'Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 Suite components (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, Teams, etc.)', '
', '
', 'Ability to work independently and simultaneously manage multiple work projects', '
', '
', 'Strong ability to work within a highly dynamic, interdependent and collaborative team', '
', '
', 'Ability to plan and manage multiple projects simultaneously', '
', '
', '
Mandatory Qualifications (cont’d):', '
', '
', 'Knowledge of application of AI and Machine Learning principles as applied to data analysis, management and visualization', '
', '
', '
Desirable characteristics:', '
', '
', 'Post-graduate certificate in data analysis or similar', '
', '
', 'Bilingualism (French/English)', '
', '
', 'Flexibility and adaptability', '
', '
', 'Ability to exercise foresight', '
', '
', 'Innovative mindset', '
', '
', '
Key Relationships:', '
', '
', '
Directly reporting to:', '
', '
', 'Acting Vice President Future Workforce Development', '
', '
', '
Additional Key relationships:', '
', '
', 'Senior Program Director Artificial Intelligence and Cybersecurity Skills Initiative (AICSI)', '
', '
', 'Senior Project Manager (TECHNATION Platforms and Applications)', '
', '
', 'Career Ready Program Manager', '
', '
', '
 What we Offer', '
', '
', '
TECHNATION is a dynamic and engaging organization with a dynamic team. We manage and lead national events, speaking forums, and educational programs that impact businesses across the country. If you like being involved in leading-edge programs that are going to impact our nation, then TECHNATION is for you! We offer:', '
', '
', '
', 'Competitive salary and benefit package; and', '
', 'Paid vacations and holidays.', '
', '
', '
We are committed to diversity in its workplaces and encourage applications from all visible minority groups, women, Aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities among other self-identified diverse groups. We also provide accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for a disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify us.', '
', '
', '
To learn more visit www.itactalent.ca', '
', '
Please note: only applications that include both a cover letter and resume will be reviewed']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Who You Are: ', 'You are a very inquisitive Data Analyst with strong mathematical skills, analytical reasoning, and understanding of hydraulic principles. You are action-oriented and full of energy for the things you see as challenging. You are a strong planner and can come up with unique solutions to problems.', 'Your mission at Smith Cameron is to ensure the highest degree of data quality is achieved and any issues are resolved in a timely manner. This data may include sanitary, storm sewer flow data, sewer system evaluation survey data, collection, system schematics, wastewater treatment plant (WWTP) records, rain data, pump station, and data.', 'To be successful in this role you make decisions in a timely manner and work well in both individual and team environments. You are technically strong and are highly adaptable.', 'About the ', 'Role: ', 'Analyze data for calibration, trends, patterns, and outliers; using graphical and statistical analysis.', 'Follow standard procedures and data processing techniques to prepare data for review and audits.', 'Identify problems with data and propose solutions.', 'Assist in final report preparation, producing work of professional quality, accurately and timely.', 'Coordinate work order management and communicate data quality issues to field staff and project managers', 'Assist with project engineering tasks.', 'Participate in the implementation of assigned projects (when time permits', 'This includes:', 'Facilitate the flow of information from the Project Manager to the Project Team.', "Complete assigned project tasks and procure required resources.Track project deliverable's.", 'Review project data for accuracy and completeness.', 'Compile project data quantities supporting the invoicing process.', 'Issue, review and close project work order documentation.', 'Review and maintain documentation for quality assurance.', 'Participate in project meetings, status updates, and debriefings.', 'Execute project tasks as needed to ensure that projects are advanced.', 'All other tasks as assigned by manager.', 'Required Experience: ', 'Degree in Water Resources, Environmental or Civil Engineering', 'Minimum 2-5 years of data analysis experience in engineering and/or environmental field.', 'Basic understanding/familiarity with databases or Geographic Information Systems (GIS)', 'Familiar with regression models and different type of statistical test', 'Knowledge of data analysis and statistics in order to find data correlation, outlier analysis and interpret the statistical result', 'Intermediate knowledge of Excel', 'Understanding of the project management processes is an asset.', 'Experience with ERP’s is an asset.', 'GIS and VBA knowledge as an asset', 'Basic understanding of ADS product lines, services, and software is an asset.', 'Competencies: ', 'Creativity', 'Comes up with many new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.', 'Dealing with Ambiguity', 'Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; is not upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on.', 'Decision Quality', 'Makes good decisions (without considering how much time it takes) based upon a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment; most of his/her solutions and suggestions turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time; sought out by others for advice and solutions.', 'Functional/Technical Skills ', 'Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment.', 'Informing ', 'Provides the information people need to know to do their jobs and to feel good about being a member of the team, unit, and/or the organization; provides individuals information so that they can make accurate decisions; is timely with information.', 'Interpersonal Savvy ', 'Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.', 'Time Management ', 'Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values time; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activities.', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent', 'Experience:', 'data analysis (engineering and/or environmental): 2 years (Required)', 'Education:', "Bachelor's Degree (Required)"]

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Data Analysts ', 'are responsible for building data models to organize important data for different teams across the business and for monitoring and handling data. With large quantities of data comes an endless possibility for mistakes, requiring Data Analysts to constantly be on the lookout for information that needs cleansing and updating. In addition to gathering, analyzing and cleansing information, Data Analysts create reports for teams and individuals across the organization. They also help translate analytics into non-technical insights to help all teams make well-informed decisions based.', 'Responsibilities: ', 'Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports', 'Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems', 'Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets', 'Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems', 'Working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs', 'Locate and define new process improvement opportunities', 'Defining new data collection and analysis processes', 'Qualifications: ', 'Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst', 'Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques', 'Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), and databases (SQL, etc.)', 'Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, etc.)', 'Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy', 'Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings', 'Strong verbal and written communication skills', 'An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving', 'BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent', 'Experience:', 'data analyst: 3 years (Preferred)']
CLUSTER JOB: Data Analysts ', 'are responsible for building data models to organize important data for different teams across the business and for monitoring and handling data. With large quantities of data comes an endless possibility for mistakes, requiring Data Analysts to constantly be on the lookout for information that needs cleansing and updating. In addition to gathering, analyzing and cleansing information, Data Analysts create reports for teams and individuals across the organization. They also help translate analytics into non-technical insights to help all teams make well-informed decisions based.', 'Responsibilities: ', 'Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports', 'Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems', 'Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets', 'Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems', 'Working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs', 'Locate and define new process improvement opportunities', 'Defining new data collection and analysis processes', 'Qualifications: ', 'Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst', 'Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques', 'Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), and databases (SQL, etc.)', 'Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, etc.)', 'Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy', 'Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings', 'Strong verbal and written communication skills', 'An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving', 'BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent', 'Experience:', 'data analyst: 3 years (Preferred)

JOB DESCRIPTION:
['Company Description', '
', '
At Ubisoft Montreal, a preeminent developer of video games located in Montreal’s dynamic Mile-End neighbourhood since 1997, we offer a work environment unique in the industry for allowing you to build and cultivate games that are part of critically acclaimed, iconic AAA franchises of international repute.', '
When you join Ubi Montreal, you enter a community of passionate, extraordinary developers connected by their need to innovate, to be creative and to work with the latest technology. You’ll discover a world where employees enjoy constant career advancement, a supportive learning environment, and competitive compensation packages.', '
', '
', 'Job Description', '
', '
Summary', "
We are looking for a passionate data analyst to join the Advanced Analytics and Data Science team within Ubisoft's Enterprise Data department. You will be exposed to a very diverse and large amount of data and take part in exciting projects mobilizing diverse experts including analysts, engineers, data scientists, dashboarding and automation experts.", '
You will work closely with various business teams, specifically those in charge of user accounts and security, to conduct analyses and make recommendations based on their needs. Depending on the mandate, you may use various tools and techniques from basic reporting to dashboarding to machine learning models. The idea is to leverage any knowledge and expertise you may have to deliver powerful results and insights.', '
Responsibilities', '
Contribute to the development of reports (for different teams) detailing the behaviour and interaction of users with the Ubisoft platform and products (« tracking system »);', '
Provide systematic, reliable, meaningful data estimates;', '
Deliver data analysis through charts and reports, which will be integrated in internal presentations;', '
Conduct comparative analyses to identify patterns and trends;', '
Propose relevant analyses (whether exploratory, descriptive or predictive) that meet the needs and have the maximum possible impact;', '
Participate to the development of the tracking system, formulate recommendations to help improve the current process and the report templates;', '
Build tools to showcase analysis results using tools like Tableau;', '
Perform any other related tasks.', '
', '
', 'Qualifications', '
', '
Education', '
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field;', '
Master’s degree is a plus;', '
Data analytics/science related certification(s) is a plus.', '
Relevant experience', '
Minimum 2 years in a data analyst or data scientist role;', '
Experience working with high volumes of data;', '
Expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.', '
Skills', '
Excellent statistical skills and analytical mindset;', '
Teradata and/or Hadoop (Spark, Informatica);', '
Developing and maintaining ETL solutions;', '
Great communication and presentation skills;', '
Ability to communicate ideas easily to both functional and technical users;', '
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy;', '
Adept at queries, tool building (reports, dashboards, etc) and presenting findings.', '
Knowledge', '
Fluency in English is required;', '
Good knowledge of Python or R;', '
Good knowledge of relational databases and fluency in SQL;', '
Good knowledge Tableau or similar tools;', '
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets;', '
Knowledge or interest in Machine Learning;', '
Agile knowledge is a plus.', '
Additional Information', '
', '
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.']

', '
At Ubisoft Montreal, a preeminent developer of video games located in Montreal’s dynamic Mile-End neighbourhood since 1997, we offer a work environment unique in the industry for allowing you to build and cultivate games that are part of critically acclaimed, iconic AAA franchises of international repute.', '
When you join Ubi Montreal, you enter a community of passionate, extraordinary developers connected by their need to innovate, to be creative and to work with the latest technology. You’ll discover a world where employees enjoy constant career advancement, a supportive learning environment, and competitive compensation packages.', '
', '
', 'Job Description', '
', '
Summary', "
We are looking for a passionate data analyst to join the Advanced Analytics and Data Science team within Ubisoft's Enterprise Data department. You will be exposed to a very diverse and large amount of data and take part in exciting projects mobilizing diverse experts including analysts, engineers, data scientists, dashboarding and automation experts.", '
You will work closely with various business teams, specifically those in charge of user accounts and security, to conduct analyses and make recommendations based on their needs. Depending on the mandate, you may use various tools and techniques from basic reporting to dashboarding to machine learning models. The idea is to leverage any knowledge and expertise you may have to deliver powerful results and insights.', '
Responsibilities', '
Contribute to the development of reports (for different teams) detailing the behaviour and interaction of users with the Ubisoft platform and products (« tracking system »);', '
Provide systematic, reliable, meaningful data estimates;', '
Deliver data analysis through charts and reports, which will be integrated in internal presentations;', '
Conduct comparative analyses to identify patterns and trends;', '
Propose relevant analyses (whether exploratory, descriptive or predictive) that meet the needs and have the maximum possible impact;', '
Participate to the development of the tracking system, formulate recommendations to help improve the current process and the report templates;', '
Build tools to showcase analysis results using tools like Tableau;', '
Perform any other related tasks.', '
', '
', 'Qualifications', '
', '
Education', '
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field;', '
Master’s degree is a plus;', '
Data analytics/science related certification(s) is a plus.', '
Relevant experience', '
Minimum 2 years in a data analyst or data scientist role;', '
Experience working with high volumes of data;', '
Expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.', '
Skills', '
Excellent statistical skills and analytical mindset;', '
Teradata and/or Hadoop (Spark, Informatica);', '
Developing and maintaining ETL solutions;', '
Great communication and presentation skills;', '
Ability to communicate ideas easily to both functional and technical users;', '
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy;', '
Adept at queries, tool building (reports, dashboards, etc) and presenting findings.', '
Knowledge', '
Fluency in English is required;', '
Good knowledge of Python or R;', '
Good knowledge of relational databases and fluency in SQL;', '
Good knowledge Tableau or similar tools;', '
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets;', '
Knowledge or interest in Machine Learning;', '
Agile knowledge is a plus.', '
Additional Information', '
', '
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Applications will be accepted until March 31, 2020 by applying here: ', 'https://secure.collage.co/jobs/afmc/16207', 'Job Summary: ', 'As part of the AFMC Data and Analysis team, the Data Analyst is responsible for data collection and reporting of information on the Academic Medicine system in Canada.', 'Responsibilities: ', 'Your role as a Data Analyst will focus on one or more of: Reporting, Collection, or Management and Analysis.', 'Reporting (Essential)', 'Prepare (using SQL and SAS) and present research analyses, reports, and other communication materials in a clear manner adapted to the audience;', 'Review results, query and resolve anomalies enter in database, prepare tables for publication;', 'Prepare / type set annual publication for hard copy publication and distribution, including:', 'o Biomedical & Health Care Research Revenue Survey;', 'o AFMC Annual Faculty of Medicine Survey;', 'o Admission Requirements of Canadian Faculties of Medicine;', 'o Annual Financial Questionnaire;', 'o Graduation Questionnaire; and', 'o Applicant Diversity Survey.', 'Data Collection ', 'Work collaboratively with team members, faculty of medicine leaders and stakeholders to develop surveys, questionnaires and other data initiatives that advance academic medicine and health care in Canada;', 'Develop, implement, test and deploy complex online surveys;', 'Create or modify new Data Collection Instruments (DCI) as needed;', 'Prepare, distribute and collect annual data via online surveys, data collection instruments (DCI), or data exchange/interfaces; and', 'Interact and work efficiently with committee members from all faculties of medicine across Canada.', 'Data Administration and Analysis', 'Manage research databases, including writing and maintaining SQL objects and/or SAS scripts for:', 'o Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes;', 'o Data management;', 'o Cross database aggregation;', 'o Cross database linking and matching;', 'o Quality assurance;', 'Respond to ad-hoc data requests from internal and external clients.', '(See https://afmc.ca/data-and-analysis for information on AFMC’s data holdings)', 'Additional Duties', 'Develop and monitor project timelines and deliverables on an ongoing basis;', 'Ongoing development of AFMC data collection tools and systems;', 'Participate in new data development initiatives;', 'Contribute to team projects and meetings;', 'Adhere to high standards of data privacy, confidentiality and quality; and', 'Other duties as assigned.', 'Direct Reports: ', 'None', 'Education/Certification/Experience: ', 'Post-secondary degree in a relevant science, information science or computer science field or equivalent experience', 'Demonstrated experience using SAS to generate reports (essential).', 'Demonstrated experience in Reporting and at least one of the areas above (Data Collection or Data Management and Analysis)', 'Demonstrated experience in creating Microsoft SQL or SAS views and stored procedures', 'Demonstrated ability to explain technical issues to non-technical end users', 'Language Skills: ', 'Bilingual in English in French (Asset)', 'Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints in both languages.', 'Physical Demands: ', 'While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:', 'Sit, stand and occasionally required to walk or move around the office environment;', 'May be asked to lift and move up to 20lbs.', 'Work Environment: ', 'The work environment described is a representation of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions', 'Application Process: ', 'AFMC welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.', 'We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.', 'Benefits:', 'Extended health care', 'Dental care', 'Life insurance', 'Flexible working hours', 'Vision care', 'On-site parking', 'Vacation & paid time off', 'Parental leave', 'Employee assistance programs', 'Company pension', 'Job Types: Full-time, Permanent']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Data Analyst', 'Quality, Innovation and Service are the three words which best describe Activation Laboratories Ltd. (Actlabs). With head office situated in Ancaster, Ontario, we provide services in over 90 countries and have several strategically positioned facilities that support global markets. Activation Laboratories Ltd. (Actlabs) was established in 1987 and is one of Canada’s premier service laboratories supporting a vast array of clients. We are recognized throughout the world as a leader in analytical testing, development services and delivering quality analysis. Actlabs provides analysis in the geochemical and geo-metallurgical market, material testing, agriculture, forensics, environmental and life sciences.', 'The ideal candidate would be a self-motivated individual with strong excel skills that would enjoy the opportunity to work in a team-oriented, scientifically challenging work environment.', 'Hours', 'Day shift, full time, overtime and or/week-end may be required', 'Responsibilities', 'The candidate will be working with spread sheets, processing and reporting chemical data derived from the ICP or ICP-MS instrumentation.', 'Competencies Required', 'B.Sc. in the fields of analytical chemistry', 'Other Requirements', '· Strong skills in analytical chemistry and excel', '· High performance individual who can meet timelines', '· Proven time management skills, attention to detail and motivated', '· Ability to perform under pressure during high work volume to achieve turnaround requirement', '· Exhibit strong organizational and prioritizing skills', '· Problem solver and analytical thinker', '· Ability to give suggestion and act on the next plausible step when problems arise', '· Strong computer skills, must be well versed in excel', '· Candidate must possess strong verbal and written communication skills in English', '· Ability to work well independently and with others', '· Knowledge of good laboratory practices', '· Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety and Professional Conduct Policies', 'Additional Information', 'Benefits package.', 'Suitable candidates are encouraged to forward a cover letter, resume and transcripts to Human Resources Manager via e-mail. Include the position name in the subject line.', 'Please note that applicants applying for Canadian job positions must be authorized to work in Canada.', 'We welcome resumes from all interested candidates; however, only qualified applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.', 'Quality Analysis in a Timely Fashion – Innovative Technologies', 'Dedicated to Supporting our Clients', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Our major telecom client, Bell Canada, is looking for experienced BI data analysts to work on large scale IT projects.', 'Job Requirements', '3+ years....', 'Experience in the development of complex data queries and processes using various tools and technologies', 'Experience in detailed data analysis', 'Experience in data presentations and visualizations', 'Experience in presenting data reports to management and executives', 'Work with business analysts to understand the business requirements', 'Translate business requirements into technical ETL solutions', 'Support the current production versions and help investigate issues and identify root causes and get it fixed as soon as possible', 'Education/Experience: ', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems is an asset", 'Strong MS-Excel experience is a required', 'Good problem solving and debugging skills', 'Experience with reading/writing and editing SQL procedures', 'Experience with ETL development as a data analyst', 'Microstrategy tool experience is an asset', 'Background in a customer interfacing role', 'Preferred: ', 'Telecom industry experience or knowledge', 'Moerae Solutions Incorporated values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. JOB DESCRIPTION:
['WHO WE ARE:', '
Homeowners invest their time, money and dreams to create the perfect space to call home. Founded in 2006 by Nancy Peterson, HomeStars is Canada’s #1 marketplace dedicated to helping homeowners research, connect with, and hire the best and most reliable home service pros.', '
Our proprietary algorithm connects hundreds of thousands of homeowners each year with the right pro for the job. Our review-based platform is the online alternative to traditional word-of- mouth, enabling our network of 60K+ pros to showcase their business for growth.', '
', '
Speaking of growth, we’re expanding our team, and we need your help!', '
', '
WHY JOIN US:', '
HomeStars is looking to continue to build a positive, winning culture and that starts with hiring great people like you! If you are looking to be part of something great, work on a dynamic and growing team, we want to hear from you.', '
', '
Perks of working at HomeStars:', 'We are growing fast. HomeStars is part of the ANGI Homeservices Inc. family which is public and includes top home service brands like Home Advisor and Angie’s List.
', 'Excellent Benefits Package. We want a healthy and productive team.
', 'Company-wide social events and team-building activities.
', 'December Break. The office is closed the week before New Year’s.
', 'Personal Growth. We seek to provide employees with constructive feedback to foster their career growth.
', 'Beautiful brick & beam office in the heart of the entertainment district in Toronto.
', 'Rec room with lounge, ping pong, darts, and foosball.', '
', '
', 'ABOUT YOU:', '
', 'You are an analytical thinker that can easily communicate and build relationships cross-functionally
', 'You strategize at a high level and execute on the details with strong analytical skills', '
', 'You are a creative problem solver', '
', 'You love numbers and can explain complex analyses to the non-technical', '
', 'You start all your analyses with the question WHY', '
', 'THE OPPORTUNITY:', '
', 'Be a key contributor to HomeStars Analytics Strategy which is centered on enabling self serve analytics across the company
', 'Collaborate cross-functionally with other departments and stakeholders on data-driven initiatives
', 'Identify business trends utilizing various data sources, design user-centric reports and provide high-level summaries and recommendations', '
', 'Communicate results to key stakeholders with recommendations while considering risks and predicting potential problems', '
', 'Collaborate with data stewards across the company to maintain a data dictionary, report automation workflows, and reporting standards', '
', 'Requirements', '
', '1-2 years of experience in a highly analytical or quantitative function, preferably in a SaaS business would be an asset', '
', 'Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Maths, Statistics, Computer Science, or Business', '
', 'Strong research and analytical skills', '
', 'Strong attention to detail; the ability to identify multiple sources/approaches of information to ensure that details are addressed', '
', 'Expertise and extensive hands-on experience with SQL, R or Python
', 'Experience with various data sources and visualization tools (Tableau, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Salesforce)', '
', 'Ability to manage several tasks simultaneously; ability to establish priorities', '
', 'Benefits', '
We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.']

JOB DESCRIPTION: ['Company description', 'The NetPhys Lab is a academic research lab.', 'NetPhys lab studies neural pathways and mechanisms that control pain perception.', 'A core focus of NetPhys Lab is predictive analytics geared at using multimodal brain imaging data (fMRI, DWI, behavior, clinical) for developing diagnostic tools to stratify patients into groups and to predict treatment outcomes, especially in people who suffer from chronic pain.', 'For more information see lab website:', 'netphyslab.com', 'Job description', 'A neuroscience professor is looking for a data analyst to write code in MATLAB. The analyst will be given sample code and projects to code simple MATLAB data analysis and/or to prepare graphics and to set up cognitive neuroscience experiments. Writing reports and preparing figures are a component of the job. Good communication skills, strong thinking ability and work ethic will be expected.', 'Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract', 'Experience:', 'coding: 1 year (Preferred)']
